abstract: Don't make the mistake of assuming that the upcoming retrospective, "Terence Conran: The Way We Live Now," in London is a swan song.
snippet: Don't make the mistake of assuming that the upcoming retrospective, "Terence Conran: The Way We Live Now," in London is a swan song.
lead_paragraph: The British design doyen Sir Terence Conran is showing signs of his 80 years. He sits in one of the Finnish designer Yrjo Kukkapuro's Karuselli chairs not just because it's a design classic, but also because its curves soothe his bones. "I have a fairly bad back," he admits. But don't make the mistake of assuming that his retrospective exhibition, "Terence Conran: The Way We Live Now," at the Design Museum in London from Nov. 16 through March 4, 2012, is a swan song.
